pullRequest.body:
Based on a de Bruijn 1976 paper.
This file is just the basic definition of a digit expansion. Will be followed up with furhter constructions.


---

### PR summary [3df953990a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13964/commits/3df953990abbcdd60f9f8189584a921a53e57970)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Data.DigitExpansion.Defs`|505|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ DigitExpansion`
`+ Negative`
`+ Negative.leftShift`
`+ Negative.negative_cutoff`
`+ Negative.of_leftShift`
`+ Negative.of_shift`
`+ Negative.shift`
`+ Positive`
`+ Positive.leftShift`
`+ Positive.of_leftShift`
`+ Positive.of_shift`
`+ Positive.shift`
`+ cutoff`
`+ cutoff_apply_le`
`+ cutoff_apply_lt`
`+ cutoff_apply_self`
`+ cutoff_cutoff_of_le`
`+ cutoff_idem`
`+ cutoff_zero`
`+ difcar`
`+ difcar_cutoff_cutoff_of_le`
`+ difcar_eq_one_iff`
`+ difcar_eq_zero_iff`
`+ difcar_eq_zero_or_one`
`+ difcar_le_one`
`+ difcar_pred_eq_difcar`
`+ difcar_pred_eq_one`
`+ difcar_pred_eq_zero`
`+ difcar_self`
`+ difcar_self_single_eq_zero`
`+ difcar_single_single_eq_zero_of_le`
`+ difcar_single_single_of_lt_eq_one_iff_lt`
`+ difcar_single_single_of_lt_eq_zero_iff_le`
`+ difcar_single_single_self`
`+ difcar_zero_right`
`+ exists_bounded`
`+ ext`
`+ funLike`
`+ instance {Z : Type*} [Preorder Z] [SuccOrder Z] [NoMaxOrder Z] {b : â„•} [hb : NeZero b] :`
`+ leftInverse_leftShift_shift`
`+ leftInverse_shift_leftShift`
`+ leftShift`
`+ leftShift_apply`
`+ leftShift_eq_zero`
`+ leftShift_single`
`+ leftShift_zero`
`+ mk_apply`
`+ negative_cutoff_iff`
`+ not_negative_of_isEmpty`
`+ not_negative_zero`
`+ not_positive_of_isEmpty`
`+ not_positive_zero`
`+ shift`
`+ shift_apply`
`+ shift_eq_zero`
`+ shift_single`
`+ shift_zero`
`+ single`
`+ single_apply_of_ne`
`+ single_apply_self`
`+ single_eq_zero_iff`
`+ single_positive_of_ne_zero`
`+ single_zero`
`+ toFun_apply`
`+ zero_apply`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

Two questions: 
* Can we be confident this will be finished? I wouldn't want half of the construction in Mathlib and then it to stall.
* As this is presumably a "leaf" construction, could it go in Archive or a separate repository rather than Mathlib properly? (But perhaps I am missing some consequence or application.)

> * Can we be confident this will be finished? I wouldn't want half of the construction in Mathlib and then it to stall.

In the PR that references this one, I have everything proved but the multiplication. I think that part ends up being straightforward after all the preliminary work I've done, since it is composition of functions.

> * As this is presumably a "leaf" construction, could it go in Archive or a separate repository rather than Mathlib properly? (But perhaps I am missing some consequence or application.)

We could put in Archive, sure. One application of this type of construction is inter-op with digit-based representations for rationals, reals, and p-adics. For example, if one wanted to construct implementations of [computable p-adics](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1701.06794) then their fidelity in representing the p-adics is often argued via their digit representations. I would then argue that computational-implementation ~ digit representation ~ Q_p -- without having to make claims about cauchy sequences, etc.

Okay! I'm convinced by the above that this can go in Mathlib rather than Archive. However I might then leave further review to someone with more perspective of p-adic applications. (Or just anyone. :-)

```suggestion
/-- Difference carry as an auxiliary function for defining subtraction. -/
```
When `b = 2`, this doesn't ban an infinite series of `1` at the top digits, right?
I guess I'm not clear on whether this is trying to ban `...222222121.01` or `012.12122222222...`

pullRequest.title: feat(Data/DigitExpansion): begin defining variant of reals without rationals

source.title: feat(Data/DigitExpansion): reals via digit expansion are complete
